string.text: Cocoon

A small, irregularly-shaped artifact formed in gravitational anomalies. Its exterior structure resembles caterpillar silk. Cocoons are not radioactive and have little value to stalkers, but can fetch a good price with artifact collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Stone Skin
 -- Receiving melee damage grants you Stone skin stack.
 -- With receiving stack you get 10% melee damage protection but receive 10% speed penalty.
 -- Each stack grows protection with diminishing returns and penalize speed more.
 -- Maximum 10 stacks is possible, at which you receive 75% reduction of melee damage but become completely immobilized.
 -- Effect lasts for 10 seconds, after which all stacks are burned.
 -- Multiple artefact increase the rate of gaining stacks.
Cell

An artifact formed in gravitational anomalies, likely due to intense localized magnetic fields. Its interior structure spins perpetually on its axis as long as it is not disturbed. A useless trinket to stalkers, it is highly valued by collectors and scientists. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Disintegrator
 -- Disintegrates part of the bullet coming to you. Unfortunately in the process a lot of radiation is emitted, making you ill.
 -- Reduces bullet damage by 15%.
 -- Reduced amount of damage is converted to radiation.
 -- Stacks with multiple artefacts.
Fountain

A common artifact formed in gravitational anomalies. It does not have any useful properties to stalkers, but because of its bizarre shape it is very valued by collectors. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Letyshops Time
 -- Receive 2% cashback on each buy.
 -- Stacks with multiple artefacts.
Spike

A common artifact formed in gravitational anomalies, that resembles petrified wood or bone. Has no useful properties to stalkers and is not radioactive, but can be sold as a trinket outside the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Critical Ascension
 -- Consecutive hits give 3% bonus to damage of your next shot.
 -- Hitting enemy in the critical place gives 6% bonus.
 -- Missing the shot resets the bonus stack and gives psy damage penalty proportional to the stack you had.
 -- Bonus can be stacked infinitely as long as you don't miss.
 -- Each extra artefact adds 2% to both normal and critical hits.
 -- Unequipping all Spike artefacts will remove the stack without penalties.
Signet

An artifact that appears to be a warped metal nut. Occasionally also called an "Amulet". Quite useless, though some stalkers believe that wearing one of these brings good luck. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Light of Tranquility
 -- Restores health and psy while being near campfire, amplifies psy recovery artefacts near campfire.
 -- Effect stacks with each artefact on belt.
Thistle

A common artifact spawned in gravitational anomalies. Despite their prickly appearances, Thistles seem incapable of penetrating flesh or damaging the body in any way. These artifacts are light, non-radioactive, and highly valued by jewelers and collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Bat

A rare and beautiful artifact, consisting of two irregularly-shaped "wings" protecting a lustrous spherical core. Does not emit radiation, but has no useful properties to stalkers, and is quite heavy. Highly valued by collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Sun

A rare artifact that is very much appreciated by collectors. Its exterior shell is unremarkable, but if cracked like a geode, reveals a swirling luminous core that emits a constant source of warm yellow light. These specimens are not otherwise radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Solar Powered
 -- Gives health and stamina boost at clear weather, little stamina boost at partly clear and stamina penalty at not clear and at night.
 -- Effect stacks with each artefact on belt.
Heart

A bizarrely-shaped artifact, whose crystalline core resembles a miniature human circulatory system. Has no useful properties to stalkers and is not radioactive, but is valuable to collectors outside of the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Will to Live
 -- Gives stronger health regen the less health you have if you have lower than 25% of health up to that amount.
 -- More artefacts increase the regen and slightly increases the highest health to trigger.
Chain

An unusual circular artifact, not to be confused with a Ring. Generates a strong gravitational field while nothing touches it. Has no useful properties to stalkers and is suprisingly heavy. Valuable to artifact collectors outside of the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Atom

A rare and unusual artifact that resembles the old Bohr model of an atom. Not radioactive, but does produce a small amount of heat. Has no useful properties to stalkers, but is very valuable to collectors and scientists.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Arszi's Blessing
 -- Converts radiation illness to stamina boost and gives light radiation cure.
 -- More artefacts make boost bigger but less continuous.
Beacon

A clotted mass of superdense ferrous metals. Not radioactive, and contains rare minerals that are used in industrial production, so there is a high demand for this artifact outside the Zone. Has no other useful properties to stalkers in the field.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: The Unorthodox Way Of Travelling
 -- Killing anyone will teleport you to the place of your victim's death.
 -- Don't try this on crows.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Knot

This artifact is occasionally formed in the extreme heat of thermal anomalies. It has an odd, lustrous appearance and is therefore appreciated by collectors. Not radioactive, and has no useful properties to stalkers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Deal with the Devil
 -- Gamechanger Artefact.
 -- Moving the artefact to belt will sign the Pact with the Zone.
 -- The Zone empowers your Knot and it becomes the mysterious artefact also known as Lucifer.
Scar

This artifact allegedly has a calming effect on the human nervous system when held close to the body. It also generates a very weak gravitational and electrostatic field. Despite this, Scars are of little use to professional stalkers. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Sandstone

An artifact sometimes formed in extreme temperature anomalies. Has no useful properties to stalkers and is not radioactive. However, this artifact's core usually contains a small quantity of gold, so it has some value to traders outside the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange]Perk: Zone Infusion
 -- Stepping into anomaly of various types infuse your active weapon.
 -- Infused weapon loses 30% of its raw power but gains 50% of elemental damage power according to the anomaly type.
 -- Only electric, thermal and chemical anomalies are valid for infusion, including fields.
 -- Effect lasts for 3 minutes, the artefact must be equipped for the effect to work.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Sourpuss

A hollow spherical artifact resembling a transparent parchment of some sorts. Covered with a layer of film, it is pleasant to the touch. Has no useful properties, and is not radioactive. Valued by collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: What Colour Is Your Blood?
 -- Drains satiety to cure bleeding.
 -- Multiple artefacts increase the cure but also increase the drain.
Black Angel

An artifact of anomalous minerals that has been twisted into an ominous semi-symmetrical formation. Despite emitting no heat or radiation, it can condense water vapor in nearby air into steam. Very valued by collectors, but has no useful properties to stalkers. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Dodge This
 -- Has 20% chance to reflect 35% of bullet damage back.
 -- Nullify the damage of hit on reflection.
 -- More artefacts increase the chance to reflect with diminishing returns.
Grapes

A heavy artifact sometimes found in gravitational anomalies, it resembles drops of green-tinted amber twisted together. Can be valuable to outside collectors, but is otherwise useless. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Necessary Gluttony
 -- Provides health bonus on food consume based on its callories.
 -- Effect prolongs with each artefact on belt.
Miser's skull

A light and fragile artifact consisting of interlinked strands of anomalous plant fibers. A curiosity for outside collectors, but has no usefulness to stalkers. Not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Phantom star

This artifcat appears to be a plasma-like substance suspended within a striated transparent shell. Generates a weak gravitational field, making it difficult to hold still or balance. Not radioactive, but of limited usefulness in the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Phantom Pacifist
 -- Become invisible to anybody.
 -- You can't draw a weapon, talk to anybody or interact with anything.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Medal

An artifact consisting of a small hoop embedded with four triangular shapes, with a small central sphere embedded in the middle. Pairs of the triangular shapes opposite each other will occasionally 'flip' and trade positions on the outer ring. Valued by collectors and not radioactive, but has no useful properties in the field. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: The (Un)lucky charm
 -- 35% chance that incoming bullet damage will be fully redirected to your companion.
 -- Some companions are smarter than others and they'll smell something fishy before they die.
 -- Stacks with multiple artefacts with diminishing returns.
Moon

An artifact shaped like a lunar crescent. The exterior shell continuously generates a very dim light. Has no useful properties, not radioactive, but has some value to collectors and jewellers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Friend of the Night
 -- Gives bleeding cure and speed increase from dusk till dawn at any weather
 -- Decreases sleepiness at night, increases sleepiness at day
 -- Effect stacks with each artefact on belt
Generator

This anomalous disk is not radioactive, but generates a strong, small electromagnetic field. It can easily be made to 'spin' perpetually on its axis, and is therefore very much valued outside the Zone by those researching new sources of energy. Currently has no useful properties to stalkers within the Zone. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Godzilla is Approaching
 -- Restores batteries charge of items while sprinting.
 -- Won't revive completely dead batteries or devices with no batteries.
 -- More artefacts gives more recharge rate and slight increase in sprint speed.
Ball

Despite appearing as a mottled ball of dirt and rock, this artifact is unusually light and bouncy, hence its name. It is believed to be a product of electrical anomalies. Not radioactive, but also not particularly useful to those within the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Kick Deez Nutz
 -- Tier Based Artefact.
 -- Amplifies players mighty foot and allows him to kick more mutants, resulting in instant death.
 -- Each artefact on the belt allows to kick more monsters.
 -- Has a cooldown of 2 seconds with 1 artefact, increases with more artefacts on belt by 1 second each.
Lamp

This light, glassy artifact emits a modest amount of near-ultraviolet light. It does not produce more harmful radiation, but is quite interesting to collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Enlightening Kleptomania
 -- The artefact catches frequencies of packages and sends energy to light them up.
 -- Lights up stashes and items emitting signal to RF-receiver.
 -- The light is very dim and hardly visible at day, so searching at night is advisable.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Tapeworm

This artifact is pure silicon dioxide, twisted into an unusual shape and color by gravitational anomalies. It would be otherwise unremarkable, except for its ability to 'bend' or visually distort objects it comes into contact with. Not particularly useful to stalkers, and not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Stunner
 -- Upon receiving melee damage the enemy would be stunned for 2.5 seconds.
 -- While being stunned the enemy is disabled in fight and won't attack.
 -- Has a cooldown of 2 seconds between uses.
 -- Each extra artefact adds additional 2 seconds to effect.
Moss

An artifact formed in electrial anomalies. It has a sharp, jagged appearance but is actually quite soft and pleasing to the touch. Not radioactive, but not useful aside from as a trinket for collectors.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Culinary Hyperversity
 -- Convert energy of raw mutant meat to special abilities.
 -- Extra artefacts or eating same meat multiple times does not stack the effect.
 -- Last for 1 minute, eating different mutant meat overrides previous time and resets.
 -- %c[d_orange]Table of effects: 
 %c[d_cyan]-- Flesh meat: %c[ui_gray_2] 1%/sec health regen, 33% bullet damage penalty.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Boar meat: %c[ui_gray_2] 25% melee damage reduction.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Dog meat: %c[ui_gray_2] slight bleeding cure, 1%/sec psy regen.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Pseudodog: %c[ui_gray_2] 2%/sec psy regen, 25% psy damage reduction.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Krovosos: %c[ui_gray_2] become invisible until shooting or hitting enemy, moderate bleeding cure.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Psysos: %c[ui_gray_2] become invisible until shooting or hitting enemy, 5%/sec psy regen.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Snork: %c[ui_gray_2] 50% radiation damage reduction, 5%/sec stamina regen, 5msv/sec radiation cure, big satiety decrease.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Chimera: %c[ui_gray_2] 2%/sec health regen, 10%/sec stamina regen, 33% raditation damage reduction.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Lurker: %c[ui_gray_2] 33% chem/fire/electric anomaly damage reduction, including fields.
 -- %c[d_cyan]Tushkano: %c[ui_gray_2] 20% speed increase, 20% melee damage penalty.
Seraphim

An artifact sometimes found in electrical anomalies, consisting of several concentric spheres bound together. Periodically emits weak gravitational waves at unpredictable intervals. Not otherwise radioactive, but not useful enough for a stalker in a fight.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange]Perk: Rain of Revival. 

-- Upon receiving a fatal blow, the artefact is destroyed and player is revived.
 -- 50% of health is restored all debuffs are healed and 5 seconds of immunity are granted.
 -- Upon reviving current weapon is dropped and vision is fucked.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Electron

This artifact is a product of electrical anomalies. It is extremely heavy despite its small size. Not radioactive or valued by stalkers, but is reported to be very valued by scientists outside the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Crank High Voltage
 -- Stepping on Electra will fully recharge player's batteries of active devices.
 -- Recharges random amount of devices and batteries combined in the inventory.
 -- Gives infinite sprint for some time.
 -- Sometimes the pleasure of fresh charge is too big to handle, making you scream a bit more excited than usual.
 -- Does not stack in any way.
Claw

A beautiful glass-like artifact occasionally fished out of electrostatic anomalies. It emits no radiation, but fetches a high price with collectors and traders.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Bloodlust
 -- 10% Increase of melee damage.
 -- Vampire effect: 3.5% of new melee damage is converted to player's health.
 -- Upon killing certain mutants spawns raw chunk of meat near him.
 -- Stacks with multiple artefacts.
Basilisk

One of the few artifacts in the Zone which copes well with all kinds of physical influences on its owner.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Helium

A bright (literally) representative of the family of electrostatic artefacts. It gives off a gaseous substance that has a beneficial effect on the body. Due to its high efficiency, it is in large demand.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Gimlet

The bowl-shaped petals of this artifact can release a powerful stimulant vapor which can alter the balance of human hormones. Of little use to stalkers, it is very much sought after for medical research. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
Dragon's eye

This artifact is sometimes formed in thermal anomalies, and has the appearance of a reptile's eye. Has no useful properties to stalkers, and is not radioactive.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] inert artifact
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] valuable
 %c[d_orange] • %c[d_orange] Perk: Good ol' Ultra-Violence
 -- 5% chance that the shot would be explosive.
 -- Upon killing an npc or mutant with explosive shot it will explode violently.
 -- Explosion spawn meaty gibs and hurts everyone in the radius.
 -- User's discretion is advised.
 -- Multiple artefacts increase the chance to explode.
Eye of the Noosphere

One of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone, the Eye of the Noosphere can transport its wielder back in time, even to escape death. A tight squeeze of the artefact activates its ability, creating a restoration point to go back to on activation or death. Frequent use can cause the artefact to change colour, but if discharged too frequently it may cease to function altogether. The Eye gradually restores its power over time, supposedly being fuelled by the anomalous energy of the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[ui_white] • %c[0,255,215,0] superartefact
